meanings.definition: A game played by two teams of seven players each, in which a ball is thrown to score goals by passing it with the hands.
meanings.sent1: During recess, the kids enjoyed playing handball in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent2: The championship match of handball ended in a thrilling tiebreaker.
meanings.sent3: In handball, the players must be careful not to hit the teacher's window with the ball!
meanings.sent4: Her precision in handball was like a skilled archer hitting the bullseye every time.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the handball hitting the wall echoed through the gymnasium.

meanings.definition: A foul in soccer or basketball in which a player deliberately handles the ball with their hands.
meanings.sent1: The referee quickly called a handball when the player touched the ball with their hand.
meanings.sent2: The coach reminded the team to avoid committing a handball during the crucial match.
meanings.sent3: The handball by the player was so obvious that even the fans groaned in disappointment.
meanings.sent4: Committing a handball in the penalty area can lead to a game-changing penalty kick.
meanings.sent5: The handball violation resulted in a free throw for the opposing team.
